XVII

CICERO TO ATTICUS, GREETING.

I arn awaiting Trebatius on March the 27th, the Formiae, date os this letter. From his tidings and Matius’ March 27, letter I shall consider how to talk to Caesar. What B.C. 49 a wretched age this is! I have no doubt Caesar will urge me to come to Rome. For he gave orders that notices should be posted even at Formiae that he wanted a full house on the lst. Must I refuse? But why do I anticipate? I will write you all about it at once. From Caesar's conversation Ι shall decide whether I ought to go to Arpinum or elsewhere. I wish to celebrate my son's coming of age. Arpinum,

I think, will be the place. Please consider what Ι should do next, for my troubles have made me stupid.
